trans-unit.source: Invoking stored procedure for SQL Sink
trans-unit.target: Invoking stored procedure for SQL Sink

trans-unit.source: When copying data into SQL Server or Azure SQL/SQL Server Database, a user specified stored procedure could be configured and invoked with additional parameters.
trans-unit.target: When copying data into SQL Server or Azure SQL/SQL Server Database, a user specified stored procedure could be configured and invoked with additional parameters.

trans-unit.source: A stored procedure can be leveraged when built-in copy mechanisms do not serve the purpose.
trans-unit.target: A stored procedure can be leveraged when built-in copy mechanisms do not serve the purpose.

trans-unit.source: This is typically leveraged when extra processing (merging columns, looking up additional values, insertion into multiple tables…)
trans-unit.target: This is typically leveraged when extra processing (merging columns, looking up additional values, insertion into multiple tables…)

trans-unit.source: needs to be done before the final insertion of source data in the destination table.
trans-unit.target: needs to be done before the final insertion of source data in the destination table.

trans-unit.source: You may invoke a stored procedure of choice.
trans-unit.target: You may invoke a stored procedure of choice.

trans-unit.source: The following sample shows how to use a stored procedure to do a simple insertion into a table in the database.
trans-unit.target: The following sample shows how to use a stored procedure to do a simple insertion into a table in the database.

trans-unit.source: In this example, type is set to: SqlServerTable.
trans-unit.target: In this example, type is set to: SqlServerTable.

trans-unit.source: Set it to AzureSqlTable to use with an Azure SQL database.
trans-unit.target: Set it to AzureSqlTable to use with an Azure SQL database.

trans-unit.source: Define the SqlSink section in copy activity JSON as follows.
trans-unit.target: Define the SqlSink section in copy activity JSON as follows.

trans-unit.source: To call a stored procedure while insert data, both SqlWriterStoredProcedureName and SqlWriterTableType properties are needed.
trans-unit.target: To call a stored procedure while insert data, both SqlWriterStoredProcedureName and SqlWriterTableType properties are needed.

trans-unit.source: In your database, define the stored procedure with the same name as SqlWriterStoredProcedureName.
trans-unit.target: In your database, define the stored procedure with the same name as SqlWriterStoredProcedureName.

trans-unit.source: It handles input data from your specified source, and insert into the output table.
trans-unit.target: It handles input data from your specified source, and insert into the output table.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the parameter name of the stored procedure should be the same as the tableName defined in Table JSON file.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the parameter name of the stored procedure should be the same as the tableName defined in Table JSON file.

trans-unit.source: In your database, define the table type with the same name as SqlWriterTableType.
trans-unit.target: In your database, define the table type with the same name as SqlWriterTableType.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the schema of the table type should be same as the schema returned by your input data.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the schema of the table type should be same as the schema returned by your input data.

trans-unit.source: The stored procedure feature takes advantage of <link><linkText>Table-Valued Parameters</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The stored procedure feature takes advantage of <link><linkText>Table-Valued Parameters</linkText><title></title></link>.
